title: Im just tired of Thresh.
body:
Not just because hes in every game, but because now people dont even know how to play unless you have multiple seconds of stun to peel for them, or a free kill hook skill-shot to get them fed.

He is so META at this point that if you get anything else its looked at by some as a troll pick. Im harassed if I pick Zilean in champ select, and if we lose its because I picked Zilean... I pick Zilean because hes good against Vayne who is also in every game, but for different reasons than Thresh.

Dosnt matter though, cause people are so used to being baby sat by Thresh fok-ton O' peel, or served up free kills by is kit they dont know how to play if he isnt there with them, they play the same way... and its your fault they did it because YOU didnt get Thresh.

He hasnt just overshadowed the other supports at this point, hes become the bot-lane META in so many peoples minds that they cant play without him anymore.

Sure some people remember how to play with other supports around, but honestly most dont, and its a clear point in my opinion that Thresh is still too good if hes this popular and people cant play without him. He is literally a crutch people expect to be there for them at this point.

Well, I'll start by admitting that Thresh is simply overtuned, his kit is overloaded, and he could use a real nerf. Most preferably, put some sort of delay or some ability to reliably interrupt his darn lantern. 

I don't care about win rates or what anyone says on the matter really. His lantern is just OP as it allows way too much safety. I can deal with his hook, flay, and ultimate. His lantern (like Tahm's consume) is just stupidly annoying though. 

To the point though:
I actually hate having a thresh support (as an ADC main). I don't mean to sound arrogant, but I typically win all of my early trades as an ADC. I typically dramatically outfarm my opponents as well in the early game. I use this to build an early lead even without kills and use that to snowball the game. 

So what happens when I have a thresh support? His engage is unreliable. Sure, if he gets lucky and lands a bunch of hooks I love it, but in general every time he misses a hook that's like 20 seconds where pressure is against me bot lane and the enemy support gets to harass me for free. I don't like it. I'd much rather have a Leona or Braum who can engage more reliably and still be relevant if they miss the skillshot. And I say gets lucky because, outside of the unusual scenario where the enemy gets in a really bad position relative to the wall and minions, landing a hook is as much about the Thresh player being skilled as it is about his opponent being unskilled at dodging it. 

The other thing that happens is Relic shield. Thresh needs to actually last hit minions to get the procs. With a thresh support you need the healing on the proc because he offers no other sustain and as I mentioned has an unreliable all-in. Most thresh's seem to only have about a 60% CS rate trying to execute the relic shield unless you set up a minion for them that the wave isn't attacking. So I do this (which costs me time that I could be harassing) or I let him try to time his auto on the cannon and make me miss 40% of all cannon minions and a lot of melees to boot. I don't like it. When I'm regularly hitting 90% CS in lane I don't want a support trying to last hit, it really throws me off a LOT. Again, a Braum or Leona is going to get that last hit long before there's minion threat and I miss nothing. Much preferred. 

I also prefer to play against Thresh over Braum / Leona or even Soraka / Sona / Janna / Taric  (the former 2 because I win most trades and their sustain sort of kills that, Janna is safer during laning phase, and Taric has a heal and a targeted stun).  That said, I prefer going up against pretty much any of these champions than Thresh or Tahm Kench in the late game as both of these champions offer their allies way too much safety. 

One of the worst feelings in League is finally catching the fed enemy out of position and almost killing them, only for a Thresh lantern (or TK consume) to get them out to safety, when you KNOW they weren't counting on that (i.e. the Thresh was far away when you got the pick and simply made it there before you managed the kill).

Pretty sure that is some Salt overreaction (with all due respect) Their are many better supports than thresh, i would know because i play Support every...damn...day. Thresh included ofcourse. But i would prefer Alistar or Leona sometimes, Soraka and Sona, Blitzcrank and Bard. All supports have something about them that make them "That Support" so to say thresh is Meta is just idiotic (no offense).

But Thresh IS meta. Because he synergizes and can help ANY lane, against ANY pick. If they pick a heavy all-in or a counter to your ADC? He has lantern, box, and flay to disengage with hook to catch people off guard or punish attempted tower dives/set up for gank assistance. Winning your lane or have high synergy with your partner? Land hooks or, better yet, just run up and watch them flee from the flay->death sentence combo. There isn't really any strong pick that hard counters Thresh due to the utility he offers outside of his hook - he's basically better Blitzcrank in a lot of ways because, even if you never hit a hook, you still offer a lot of safety to your team and utility to teamfights.

I don't even own Thresh. I don't like playing him for the sole reason that I'm sick of seeing him (With some exceptions like Vi, I don't like playing very-high-play-rate champs, which is a short list, but it's still there). But I support all the time, and damned well, if I may say so.

{{champion:432}}  is all you need. Ever. Didn't even think I'd like the guy at first, in fact I used to think he just wasn't meant for solo queue and just organized team games. But then he went on free rotation, and I was like, Yeah he's kinda fun, but I dunno how useful he really is before I at least Rank 5 him in unranked...A few weeks (and a lot of game-losing missed ults) later and I'm playing him as my main ranked support. And I literally have people threaten to dodge if I pick him, because you're damned right I've seen other Brads, and I've seen how bad they are, too.

And you gotta go all Khan on them, and when they ask, "Why don't you just pick Thresh?" you respond, "Because I am...Better." They say, "At what?" And you respond, while the countdown's happening, "Everything."

And, you know, there's always {{champion:44}} (seriously, do not underestimate this guy as a high-damage, high-defense anti-Vayne weapon. Anyone who dares think he isn't any good is so beyond wrong if they pick someone who can be shut down near-instantly with a really good point-and-click stun) when you're too drunk to make proper portals for your team, or ult correctly without missing and hitting someone on your own team you really didn't want to. {{champion:143}} is still just plain underrated for a "secondary AP carry" support, but I'll happily play her too sometimes. I'm kind of amazed that so few people play her anymore, she's still pretty damage-crazy, and is a just-as-good alternative to Annie.
